TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ControlType extends System.Windows.Automation.AutomationIdentifier

Docs.summary: Identifies the type of a user interface (UI) control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationIdentifier> and is used to identify the type of a control represented by an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement>. The control type is determined by the developer of the UI Automation provider.
This class contains static fields, which are themselves <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> objects, to identify the standard types of controls. There is also a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Custom> type for controls that do not match one of the defined types.
The only case where a control's control type might change at run time is where the control supports <xref:System.Windows.Automation.MultipleViewPattern>. An example is the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_win32](~/includes/tla2sharptla-win32-md.md)] list view, which can be a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.DataGrid> or <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.List>, depending on the current view.
Control types do not have a one-to-one equivalence to control patterns. A control can be of only one type, but it may support multiple patterns or no patterns at all, depending on its specific functionality.
For detailed information on the various control types, see [UI Automation Control Types](~/docs/framework/ui-automation/ui-automation-control-types.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Button
Public Shared ReadOnly Button As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a button control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Buttons perform a single action when clicked.
A button can be used as a standalone control or as a subcontrol in another control type. For example, the drop-down arrow in a combo box control is a button. When used as a subcontrol, a button is in the control view of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] tree (not in the content view).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Calendar
Public Shared ReadOnly Calendar As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a calendar control, such as a date-picker.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType CheckBox
Public Shared ReadOnly CheckBox As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a check box control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A check box can be used as a standalone control or as a subcontrol in another control type. For example, a check box at the beginning of a row in a grid control that is used to select the row (used to manipulate the content) appears in the control view but not in the content view. However, a labeled checkbox in a form that represents data is in the content and control views.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType ComboBox
Public Shared ReadOnly ComboBox As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a combo box control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks There are two variations of combo box controls. A simple combo box presents a list that a user can select from. An editable combo box presents a list of choices and also has an editable text area where a user can type in a choice instead of being limited to selecting from the choices in the list.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Custom
Public Shared ReadOnly Custom As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a control that is not one of the defined control types.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Custom> control type indicates a control that is not identified as one of the predefined control types (such as <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Button> or <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Calendar>).
Control developers should check the other control types before designating their control as a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Custom> control type to be sure that their control does not provide the same functionality as one of the defined control types.
A <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Custom> control type requires extra work for the provider to implement [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)]. Also, UI Automation client products will not be able to anticipate the control structure, keyboard interaction, and possible control patterns based on the control type of the control.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType DataGrid
Public Shared ReadOnly DataGrid As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a data grid control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the cells contain only text, the control type should be <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Table>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType DataItem
Public Shared ReadOnly DataItem As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a data item control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.DataItem> is a complex item that can contain many other controls.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Document
Public Shared ReadOnly Document As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a document control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A document contains text content of more than one line.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Edit
Public Shared ReadOnly Edit As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies an edit control, such as a text box.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Edit> control can be used as a standalone control or as a subcontrol in another control type. For example, the area where a user can type in a value in a combo box control is an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Edit> control, and in this case the control is not part of the content view.
<xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Edit> controls can also represent controls that contain passwords. The <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.AutomationElementInformation.IsPassword%2A> property enables products such as screen readers to know whether to reveal the contents.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Automation.AutomationPattern[] GetNeverSupportedPatterns() cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves the pattern identifiers that are not supported by the control type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is useful for UI Automation clients such as test frameworks for a provider implementation that need to find all control patterns that are not permitted on this control type.
## Examples The following example calls <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.GetNeverSupportedPatterns%2A> on every kind of <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> contained as a static field in the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> class.
[!code-csharp[UIAControlTypePatterns_snip#101](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAControlTypePatterns_snip/CSharp/GetPatternsForm.cs#101)] [!code-vb[UIAControlTypePatterns_snip#101](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAControlTypePatterns_snip/visualbasic/getpatternsform.vb#101)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Automation.AutomationPattern[][] GetRequiredPatternSets() cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves an array of sets of required patterns.
Docs.returns: An array of sets of required patterns.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each element of the array contains an array of patterns, and each element that has this control type must support at least one of these arrays.
This method is useful for UI Automation clients that need to find all possible patterns, such as testing frameworks for a provider implementation.
## Examples The following example calls <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.GetRequiredPatternSets%2A> on every kind of <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> contained as a static field in the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> class.
[!code-csharp[UIAControlTypePatterns_snip#101](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAControlTypePatterns_snip/CSharp/GetPatternsForm.cs#101)] [!code-vb[UIAControlTypePatterns_snip#101](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAControlTypePatterns_snip/visualbasic/getpatternsform.vb#101)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperty[] GetRequiredProperties() cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves an array of the required property [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_id#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-idsharpplural-md.md)] for this control type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is useful for UI Automation clients that need to find all possible properties, such as testing frameworks for a provider implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Group
Public Shared ReadOnly Group As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a group control, which acts as a container for other controls.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A group is a container control that contains different control types and is used to logically associate those controls.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Header
Public Shared ReadOnly Header As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a header control, which is a container for the labels of rows and columns of information.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType HeaderItem
Public Shared ReadOnly HeaderItem As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a header item, which is the label for a row or column of information.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Hyperlink
Public Shared ReadOnly Hyperlink As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a hyperlink control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A hyperlink control navigates to a specified [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_url](~/includes/tlasharptla-url-md.md)] when a user clicks on the control.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Image
Public Shared ReadOnly Image As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies an image control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Image> control type can be used as a standalone control or as a subcontrol in another control type. For example, a button can use an image rather than text to indicate its functionality to the user.
When used only for decorative purposes, an image appears in the control view of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] tree (not in the content view).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType List
Public Shared ReadOnly List As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a list control, such as a list box.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.List> is a control type that contains <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.ListItem> and (perhaps) <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Group> control types.
A <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.List> control can be used as a standalone control or as a subcontrol in another control type. For example, a combo box has a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.List> control that contains choices that appear when the drop-down button is clicked. When used as a subcontrol, a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.List> is only in the control view of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] tree (not in content view).
When used as a subcontrol, a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.List> does not have a `Name` property assigned.
A <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.List> can contain <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.DataItem> controls.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType ListItem
Public Shared ReadOnly ListItem As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a list item control, which is a child item of a list control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Header> can also be a child of a list control.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property LocalizedControlType As String
public: property System::String ^ LocalizedControlType { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a description of the control type.
Docs.value: A localized description of the control type, such as "button".

remarks.format:
## Examples In the following example, all control types are found by reflection, and their <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.LocalizedControlType%2A> properties are output along with other information.
[!code-csharp[UIAControlTypePatterns_snip#101](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAControlTypePatterns_snip/CSharp/GetPatternsForm.cs#101)] [!code-vb[UIAControlTypePatterns_snip#101](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAControlTypePatterns_snip/visualbasic/getpatternsform.vb#101)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType LookupById(int32 id) cil managed
Public Shared Function LookupById (id As Integer) As ControlType

Docs.summary: Retrieves a that encapsulates a specified numerical identifier.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Normally the type of a control is identified by a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> object. This method enables you to construct such an object when only the numerical identifier is known.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Menu
Public Shared ReadOnly Menu As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a menu control, such as a top-level menu in an application window.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A menu is a container for a collection of menu items; for instance, the control that appears beneath **File** when you click on it and that contains **New**, **Open**, and so on.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType MenuBar
Public Shared ReadOnly MenuBar As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a menu bar control, which generally contains a set of top-level menus.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.MenuBar> control type represents the container for the set of top-level menus of an application.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType MenuItem
Public Shared ReadOnly MenuItem As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a menu item control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.MenuItem> is a child of a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Menu> or <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.MenuBar> control.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Pane
Public Shared ReadOnly Pane As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a pane control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Pane> is used to visually separate content within a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Window>. The user typically navigates between panes by pressing TAB, F6, or CTRL+TAB, depending on the context.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType ProgressBar
Public Shared ReadOnly ProgressBar As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a progress bar control, which visually indicates the progress of a lengthy operation.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType RadioButton
Public Shared ReadOnly RadioButton As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a radio button control, which is a selection mechanism allowing exactly one selected item in a group.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType ScrollBar
Public Shared ReadOnly ScrollBar As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a scroll bar control, such as a scroll bar in an application window.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.ScrollBar> control type contains a set of buttons and a thumb control that enable a user using a mouse to scroll the contents of a window or item container.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.AutomationElementInformation.AutomationId%2A> property to differentiate between the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Button> elements that correspond to the large-increment, large-decrement, small-increment, and small-decrement buttons.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Separator
Public Shared ReadOnly Separator As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a separator, which creates a visual division in controls like menus and toolbars.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Slider
Public Shared ReadOnly Slider As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a slider control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Slider> control type consists of a set of buttons associated with an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Edit> control that enable a user to select from a set of items or set a numerical value from within a range.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Spinner
Public Shared ReadOnly Spinner As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a spinner control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Spinner> control type consists of a set of buttons that enable a user to select from a set of items or set a numerical value from within a range.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType SplitButton
Public Shared ReadOnly SplitButton As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a split button, which is a button that performs a default action and can also expand to a list of other possible actions.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType StatusBar
Public Shared ReadOnly StatusBar As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a status bar control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.StatusBar> control types are generally subcontrols of <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Window> control type [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] elements.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Tab
Public Shared ReadOnly Tab As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a tab control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Tab> is a control type that contains at least one <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.TabItem> child control.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType TabItem
Public Shared ReadOnly TabItem As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a tab item control, which represents a page of a tab control.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Table
Public Shared ReadOnly Table As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a table.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Table> control type is similar to a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.DataGrid> but contains only text. Tables can also contain <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Header> control types.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Text
Public Shared ReadOnly Text As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies an edit control, such as a text box or rich text box.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Text> control can be used as a standalone control, such as an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Edit> control, or as a subcomponent, such as the area of a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.ComboBox> where a user can type in a value.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Thumb
Public Shared ReadOnly Thumb As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies the control in a scrollbar that can be dragged to a different position.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Thumb> control is used as a subcontrol in a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.ScrollBar> control type. As a subcontrol, a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Thumb> does not have a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.NameProperty>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType TitleBar
Public Shared ReadOnly TitleBar As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies the caption bar on a window.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType ToolBar
Public Shared ReadOnly ToolBar As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a toolbar, such as the control that contains a set of command buttons in an application window.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType ToolTip
Public Shared ReadOnly ToolTip As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a tooltip control, an informational window that appears as a result of moving the pointer over a control or sometimes when tabbing to a control using the keyboard.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Tree
Public Shared ReadOnly Tree As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a tree control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Tree> control type is a container for a hierarchical arrangement of <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.TreeItem> or <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.DataItem> control types.
Each node of a tree can contain other nodes. A node that contains child nodes can be displayed as expanded or collapsed.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType TreeItem
Public Shared ReadOnly TreeItem As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a node in a control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.TreeItem> control type can be used only as a subcontrol of a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Tree> control.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Window
Public Shared ReadOnly Window As ControlType

Docs.summary: Identifies a window frame, which contains child objects.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Controls of this type always support <xref:System.Windows.Automation.WindowPattern>.
